revised_title: Developmental Stages and Affinities of Balanoglossus Kowalevskii
tldr: The author describes the later stages of development in Balanoglossus Kowalevskii, a type of marine worm, and discusses its affinities to vertebrates. They observe the formation of gill slits, the development of the nervous system, and the role of the notochord-like structure in supporting the proboscis and collar. This research contributes to understanding the evolutionary relationships between invertebrates and vertebrates.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Developmental Biology
